intro: Muraltia vulpina, commonly known as the red mombin or wolfberry, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible, orange-red fruits. The fruits are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of food due to their tart flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
